clinical_study.brief_title: Subthalamic Nucleus Connectivity in Parkinson's Disease With Ultra-high Field Magnetic Resonance Imaging
clinical_study.official_title: Ultra-high Field Imaging of the Cortico-striato-subthalamic Functional and Structural Connectivity to Improve Deep Brain Stimulation Surgery in Parkinson's Disease Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the segregation of the subthalamic nucleus into its motor and non-motor regions in patients with Parkinson's disease and healthy controls with the aid of ultra-high field magnetic resonance imaging.

primary_outcome.measure: Voxels of the subthalamic nucleus that are structurally or functionally connected to the motor cortex.
primary_outcome.time_frame: One measurement, consisting of 1 MRI scan of 1 hour
primary_outcome.description: Two brain areas are said to be structurally connected if they are connected by fiber tracks computed from diffusion weighted MRI data. Two brain areas are said to be functionally connected if they show statistically significantly correlated resting state functional MRI signals.

secondary_outcome.measure: Strength of the structural and functional connectivity between the subthalamic nucleus and the motor cortex.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One measurement, consisting of 1 MRI scan of 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: Strength of the structural connectivity is defined as: fractional anisotropy along computed fiber tracks between the subthalamic nucleus and the motor cortex. Strength of the functional connectivity is defined as: height of the correlation between the resting state functional MRI signals in the subthalamic nucleus and the motor cortex.

secondary_outcome.measure: Brain areas structurally and functionally connected to the stimulation zone of the optimal electrode of operated Parkinson's patients.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One measurement, consisting of 1 MRI scan of 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: This results in a list with brain structures that are functionally and/or structurally connected to the stimulation zone.

secondary_outcome.measure: Brain areas that show an activation pattern measured with functional magnetic resonance imaging, that is correlated to a motor task.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One measurement, consisting of 1 MRI scan of 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: This results in a list of brain areas that are related to the motor task.

study_pop.textblock:
- Parkinson's patients scheduled for deep brain stimulation surgery at Maastricht University Medical Center
- Healthy volunteers from a community sample

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Both groups:
- Mental competence
Group 1:
- Parkinson's disease patients scheduled for deep brain stimulation surgery
Group 2:
- Age and gender matched volunteers
Exclusion Criteria:
Both groups:
- Head injury
- Stroke
- Other neurological diseases other than Parkinson's disease
- Metallic prostheses or pacemaker in the subject's body or other contra indications for MRI
Group 1:
- Inability to abstain from dopaminergic drug use
Group 2:
- Parkinson's disease
- Use of medication affecting the central nervous system
